sentences.english: Some played cards while others sat about a table and drank.
sentences.chinese: 一些人打牌，一些人围桌坐着喝酒。

sentences.english: I' ll drink his health in honour of its being Christmas Day.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之，城里人喝酒时都举杯祝她健康。

sentences.english: My step-dad said she only drinks on the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我的继父补充说，她只要周末才喝酒。

sentences.english: Would I like another drink? Now you're talking!
sentences.chinese: 我想再喝酒吗？你这样说才合我意了。

sentences.english: It's illegal for them to drink.
Neither shall any priest drink wine, when they enter into the inner court.
sentences.chinese: 祭司进内院的时候都不可喝酒。

sentences.english: He sponged some money from his friend and went to the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他向朋友强行借了些钱，到酒吧喝酒去了。

sentences.english: Harry is so addicted to alcohol that he'd sell his soul for a bottle of whisky.
sentences.chinese: 沉溺于喝酒，结果他会为一瓶威士忌而出卖灵魂的。

sentences.english: There are many ways to dispel your pent-up fury besides drinking!
sentences.chinese: 排解自己积愤的方法有很多种，不一定要喝酒呀。

sentences.english: Wisdom Yin found who had been secretly drinking, a big quarrel two.
sentences.chinese: 智贤发现世拉一直在偷偷的喝酒，两个大吵一架。

sentences.english: I betcha a lot of people drink and drive too.
sentences.chinese: 我敢打赌一定有很多人也边开车边喝酒。

sentences.english: Lots of people fall into the trap of thinking that a parent's drinking is only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 很多人掉入“父母喝酒只是暂时的”这样的思维陷阱。

sentences.english: Ever since the 3rd dynasty drinking it while eating bread was considered a good omen.
sentences.chinese: 早在第三王朝，喝酒吃面包被视为是吉兆。

sentences.english: "They were about three times more likely to participate in heavy drinking," says Bahr.
sentences.chinese: “他们可能有三次以上的大量喝酒，”巴尔说。

sentences.english: Some played cards, some sat about a table and drank.
sentences.chinese: 一些人打牌，一些人围桌坐着喝酒。

sentences.english: Alcoholics get special treatment making them throw up every time they drink alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 酗酒者得到特殊的治疗让他们每次在喝酒后呕吐。

definition: after drinking/under the influence of alcohol
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
never to touch a drop of alcohol
to get thoroughly drunk (idiom)/to get plastered
heavy drinking/to get drunk/to drink to excess
to urge sb to drink alcohol
to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
to love wine as one's life (idiom); fond of the bottle
